title: Implement tk approve command
description:
Add new 'approve' command to cmd/tk/main.go

Usage: tk approve <id>

Behavior:
1. Parse tick ID from positional argument
2. Load the tick
3. Verify tick has awaiting set (error if not awaiting human)
4. Set verdict = "approved"
5. Call verdict processing logic (triggers state transition)
6. Save tick
7. Output result (tick closed or returned to agent)

Implementation pattern:
- Add case "approve" to main switch
- Create runApprove(args []string, stdout, stderr io.Writer) int
- Follow existing command patterns (FlagSet, parseInterleaved, etc.)
- Support --json flag for machine-readable output

Error cases:
- No ID provided (exit code 2)
- Tick not found (exit code 4)
- Tick not awaiting human (error message, suggest checking status)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Command parses tick ID from positional arg
- [ ] Command errors if tick not awaiting human
- [ ] Command sets verdict=approved and triggers processing
- [ ] Command outputs result (closed vs returned to agent)
- [ ] --json flag works
- [ ] Error codes follow existing patterns
